intro: Alniphyllum fortunei var. microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited alniphyllum, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Styracaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by tiny, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it suitable for ornamental gardening in temperate climates. Its compact size and delicate appearance make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
